headline: Warren Buffett's Favorite Energy Stock Paces Bullish Oil Sector Move Amid Ukraine-Russia Attack
summary: Warren Buffett-backed Occidental Petroleum, Diamondback Energy, APA and Halliburton led an early rally in oil stocks Monday as oil prices jumped.  U.S. oil prices advanced more than 4% to around $63.60 per barrel on Monday.  The move higher comes despite the Saudi Arabia-led Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies, including Russia, announced Saturday it would raise oil output in July by the same amount as in the previous two months.

raw.headline: Warren Buffett's Favorite Energy Stock Paces Bullish Oil Sector Move Amid Ukraine-Russia Attack

The move higher comes despite the Saudi Arabia-led Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies, including Russia, announced Saturday it would raise oil output in July by the same amount as in the previous two months.

headline: Why Oil Prices Are Jumping After OPEC Increased Production
summary: Global oil prices rallied hard on Monday, lifting U.S. crude to the highest levels in two weeks, as investors shrugged off a planned supply increase from the OPEC+ cartel and focused on geopolitical news that could pressure energy markets over the coming months.  The Ukraine attack may have also renewed concerns that President Volodymyr Zelensky could target Russia oil installations, a move that ING commodities strategist Warren Patterson said would “change the outlook for the oil market drastically.”  Multiple media reports also suggest that a bipartisan effort by Senators Lindsey Graham (R., South Carolina) and Richard Blumenthal (D., Conn.) to sanction countries that purchase Russian oil could be ready for this month’s G-7 summit in Alberta, Canada.

raw.headline: Why Oil Prices Are Jumping After OPEC Increased Production

headline: Is Occidental Petroleum Stock a Buy Now?
summary: Occidental Petroleum is a midsized oil and natural gas company with big aspirations.  Management is hoping to compete with the largest oil companies on the planet.  Buying Oxy shares now will leave you owning a growth-focused business.

headline: Venezuela ramps ups taxes on private sector as Chevron oil exit bites
summary: Washington in February canceled key licenses for a handful of partners and customers of state oil company PDVSA, including Chevron, that had allowed them to export Venezuelan oil under U.S. sanction exemptions.  It also imposed secondary tariffs on Venezuela's oil buyers.

headline: Oil Prices Jump. It Isn’t Just OPEC This Time.
summary: Oil prices were surging on Monday, driven higher by a flare-up in tensions between Russia and Ukraine and a lower-than-expected output hike by the OPEC+ cartel of producers.  The  Brent  international benchmark jumped 3% to just under $65 a barrel, and  West Texas Intermediate  U.S. prices jumped 3.4% to just under $63 a barrel.  Crude was rallying after Ukraine launched drone attacks on four military airports in Russia, destroying more than 40 warplanes.

raw.headline: Oil Prices Jump. It Isn’t Just OPEC This Time.
